text: Sir George Grey (1812–1898) was the Governor of Cape Colony, South Australia and New Zealand. George Grey may also refer to: * Sir George Grey, 2nd Baronet (1799–1882), British politician * George Grey, 2nd Earl of Kent (1454–1505) * George Grey (skier) (born 1979), Canadian cross-country skier * George Charles Grey (1918–1944), British politician, Member of Parliament for Berwick-upon- Tweed * George Grey, 5th Earl of Stamford (1737–1818), English nobleman * George Grey, 6th Earl of Stamford (1765–1845), British peer and politician * George Grey, 7th Earl of Stamford (1827–1883), English peer * Sir George Grey, 1st Baronet (1767–1828), British Royal Navy officer * George Grey, 8th Baron Grey of Groby (1802–1835), British peer * George Kruger Grey (1880–1943), British artist and designer == See also == * George Gray (disambiguation)
title: George Grey (disambiguation)
